page.title: 19Church Lawford Aerodrome 1
page.content: Church Lawford a village close to Long Lawford has a disused airfield within it,although to say it is not used id not strictly correct as it's runways are used as a training ground for truck drivers.Part of the rest of the airfield is used by the Royal Observer Corps. as a local headquarters.Most of the original buildings are still in place and still occasionally used for military storage, though very rarely now. The aerodrome seems to have been built some time in the early 1930's and initially it was a private airfield which seems to have as a claim to fame the fact that planes like 'The Flying Flea' performed stunts there at several air shows. Other attractions at these shows organised by Sir Alan Cobham were gliding and parachuting.
